title: 103_hr2380
content: The "Maritime Trust Fund Act" imposes a 5 percent tax on passenger payments for voyages not calling at U.S. ports. It also introduces an excise tax on containers used for importing or exporting commercial cargo. These amendments take effect upon the Act's enactment. SEC. 3. EXCISE TAX ON CONTAINERS USED TO IMPORT OR EXPORT COMMERCIAL CARGO. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to impose a tax on containers used for importing or exporting cargo. A tax of $15 per 20-foot equivalent unit is imposed on taxable container use, to be paid by the shipper at the time of exportation or entry. Taxable container use refers to loading a container with commercial cargo. The tax of $15 per 20-foot equivalent unit is imposed on taxable container use, which involves loading commercial cargo on a vessel for export from or entry into the United States. The terms 'commercial cargo', 'commercial vessel', and 'port' are defined under section 4462, and the United States includes its possessions. The tax rules for taxable container use are subject to special rules similar to those in section 4462. Additionally, a clerical amendment is made to the table of subchapters in chapter 36 of the Code. The amendments made by this section regarding containers used for importing or exporting cargo will be effective on January 1, 1996. Additionally, a new section on the Maritime Trust Fund is added to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Maritime Trust Fund is established in the Treasury of the United States, funded by net revenues from maritime taxes. The fund is created to support maritime activities and infrastructure. The Maritime Trust Fund, funded by maritime taxes, supports maritime activities and infrastructure. Amounts in the fund are used for expenditures related to laws similar to the Merchant Marine Act, 1936. The curr_chunk discusses a proposed amendment similar to the Merchant Marine Act, 1936, as introduced in the 103d Congress. It includes a clerical amendment to the table of sections for a specific subchapter. The curr_chunk discusses a proposed amendment related to the Maritime Trust Fund.
